AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: Arachnid worker
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: Workers are the most numerous representatives of the arachnids, performing all the tasks of transporting, building and laying tunnels in solid ground for the swarm. Their shells are very thin and can crack even from being hit by a bat, which is compensated for by their high speed of movement and the ability to lift as much as they weigh themselves, thanks to four three-fingered hands. They have one pair of eyes adapted for darkness, which forces them to hide in the darkness during the day.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: Arachnid soldier
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: The soldier can be found accompanying the workers. Their moderately thick shell on all sides is able to protect them from arrows from short bows. The head is also reinforced with a layer of strong chitin that can protect it from being hit by a club. The antennae are naked, which can be called their weak point if they do not have time to hide them in the head during the blow. They have a pair of three-fingered hands, a pair of claws with thick chitin, which makes them versatile representatives of the species.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: Arachnid warrior
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: They have a thick shell that makes up half of their weight. They can be called the main force of the swarm. The chest plates provide excellent protection against arrows and piercing blows, and the thick carapace on the back is able to withstand a burst of small-bore weapons. They have a thick layer of chitin on the head, under which two additional sets of eyes are hidden. Unlike other subspecies, warriors do not have working limbs, which makes them practically useless outside of combat. The limbs in the form of four powerful claws and two legs are covered with only a small layer of chitin, which forces the beetle to hide the claws in the shell. Warriors usually sleep in the hive and leave it if an enemy appears that the soldiers cannot handle.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: Arachnid scholary
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: A one of a kind arachnid with a semblance of scientific thinking. He is able to collate data and facts while doing research. A rather demanding and frail representative of the species, which, however, is often the core of the hive.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: Arachnid bombardier
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: A one of a kind arachnid with a semblance of scientific thinking. He is able to collate data and facts while doing research. A rather demanding and frail representative of the species, which, however, is often the core of the hive.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: Arachnid ram
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: Living siege tanks, ramming arachnids, thanks to their toughest chitinous exoskeleton and the terrible strength of their mandibles, are able to withstand an enormous number of blows. However, rams have a mediocre movement speed and also consume a lot of food.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: Arachnid recycler
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: Sedentary and helpless arachnids that serve for storing and processing food. These insects store large amounts of food and digest everything into jelly.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: Arachnid cerebral
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: The arachnid cerebral is a rare and unique species in the evolutionary hierarchy of arachnids. Among the mid-sized representatives of its class, this magnificent organism impresses with its striking design and functional adaptations. The head of the cerebral arachnid occupies an astonishing 60% of the total body mass, indicating its phenomenal brain power. The psychic abilities of the cerebral arachnid go far beyond ordinary empathy, penetrating the consciousness and emotional state of those around them. With the help of his powerful psychic field, this magnificent arachnid is able to manipulate the thoughts and will of other beings, as if registering and directing streams of consciousness in the desired direction. However, despite his incredible abilities, the cerebral arachnid finds himself limited by his gene pool. He is able to strengthen his psychic abilities only if there is a specialized structure in the hive. These biological towers, with a height and power proportional to the importance of the arachnid cerebral, serve as a source of psionic energy that allows one to unleash its potential. If they are destroyed by the invaders, the cerebral arachnid will temporarily feel unbearable torment of mental pain, going into a state of mental blockage. However, despite these physiological limitations, the arachnid cerebral remains one of the most powerful and influential members of its organized structure. His outstanding psychic abilities and unwavering commitment to advanced tactics and strategy make him an indispensable leader in battle. Thanks to his phenotypic potential, he can gradually enhance his psionic abilities, adapting to changing conditions and meeting the evolving needs of his hive. Arachnid Cerebral is the true embodiment of the strength and intelligence of the arachnid world.
